hypothesis_content.title: BTC Momentum Acceleration After 3-Day Consolidation Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC consolidates within a ±1.5% range for 3 consecutive days in a NEUTRAL regime, a daily close above the consolidation high with volume > 20% above 20-day average triggers a momentum acceleration phase lasting 3-5 days with average gains of 4-7%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended consolidation in neutral markets represents pent-up energy. Breakouts with volume confirmation signal institutional accumulation and momentum trader entry. The 3-day consolidation period filters out noise while maintaining sensitivity to emerging trends.
entry_conditions: BTC daily price range (high-low)/close < 1.5% for 3 consecutive days
Daily close > consolidation high (highest high of 3-day period)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% gain from entry OR 3 days in trade, whichever comes first
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close below consolidation low (lowest low of 3-day period)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 55% win rate OR average profit < 2% when tested across 100+ instances since 2020. Fails if more than 40% of signals result in immediate reversal (stop loss hit within 2 days).
